title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ગાઉં ભક્ત ગુજરાતના, જેના પ્રેમનો નહિ પાર; 
ભાવ ભક્તિ અતિ ઘણી, વળી નિયમધારી નરનાર્ય.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A devotional song from Gujarat, where love knows no bounds; The fervor and passion are immense, following the laws of men and women.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
પ્રકટ પુરુષોત્તમને મળી, વળી થયાં પૂરણકામ<RHYME_206631>; 
એવાં જન પાવનનાં, હવે લખું કાંયેક નામ<RHYME_206631>.
gujarati.context: The great men who have achieved their goals and completed their tasks have found the ultimate truth; I will now write the name of someone like them.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ધન્ય જેતલપુરનાં જન<RHYME_206632>, જિયાં હરિએ કર્યા જગન<RHYME_206632>; 
તિયાં જે જે રહ્યા હરિજન<RHYME_206632>, તેને જાણવાં પરમ પાવન<RHYME_206632>.
gujarati.context: The people of Jetpur are blessed by God and their lives are governed by His divine will. One who understands this truth is truly enlightened and grateful to the Lord.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત ગંગાદાસ નામ<RHYME_206631>, પ્રભુદાસ આશજી અકામ<RHYME_206631>; 
ભક્ત કાકુજી ભિખારીદાસ, પીતાંબર ભજે અવિનાશ.
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet describes Bhakt Patel as a devotee of Lord Ganges and his name is Prabhu Das, who has abandoned worldly desires. He lives a life of devotion, singing praises to the eternal Lord Pitanamber.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જોયતાદાસ જીવણ કહીએ<RHYME_206633>, કૃષ્ણદાસ કાશીદાસ લહીએ<RHYME_206633>; 
ભક્ત ખોડો નથુ પુંજોભાઈ, એહાદિ પટેલ કહેવાઇ.
gujarati.context: When Joshi's servants speak of devotion, Kashi's devotees weep; Bhakt Khodo says that the pride of Patel is not in showy deeds.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત ઉભે આશારામ<RHYME_206634>, જન દેવરામ દયારામ<RHYME_206634>; 
ઊગરચંદ ને બેચરભાઈ<RHYME_206635>, બાઈ રળિયાત હર્ખબાઈ<RHYME_206635>.
gujarati.context: The devout devotee stays in the sacred ashram, praying to God Rama with compassion; just as a bereaved child laments the departure of a mother, similarly one mourns the loss of spiritual guidance.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી વાલો ભાઈ હરિજન<RHYME_206632>, ઠાર લવજી જીવો પાવન<RHYME_206632>; 
માળી માણ્યકશા ને કુબેર<RHYME_206636>, ભક્ત ઘેલો ખરો નહિ ફેર<RHYME_206636>.
gujarati.context: The noble person (Kshatriya) is also a devotee of God, and one should maintain the divine virtues; do not be fooled by external appearances, for true devotion is in the heart.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ છે જન અપાર<RHYME_206637>, વસે જેતલપુર મોઝાર<RHYME_206637>; 
પટેલ ભક્ત વેણીભાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206633>, લાલદાસ કાળિદાસ લહીએ<RHYME_206633>.
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet compares the universe to a vast city like Vasai-Pol, where people are abundant and busy. The poet, Patel Bhakt, says that even greats like Laladas and Kalidas felt overwhelmed in their pursuit of creative endeavors.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ગોપાલ હાંસજી હરિજન<RHYME_206632>, હરખા આદિ છે ભક્ત પાવન<RHYME_206632>; 
દ્વિજ ભગો ને ખુશાલભાઈ, એહાદિ જન અશલાલી માંઇ.
gujarati.context: Gopal Hansaji is a devotee of God, considered as one who has reached the pinnacle of devotion; He rejoices at the mere thought of the divine couple's union.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી ભગુજી માલજી લહીએ<RHYME_206633>, નથુજી દેવોજી જેઠીજી કહીએ<RHYME_206633>; 
પટેલ જેઠો દાજી ને દેસાઈ, નરોત્તમ ને નથુ કહેવાઇ.
gujarati.context: A king's pride is his greatest loss, and he will not be praised by the gods or others. A Patel's greatness only makes him more humble, and he will not be boastful about it.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
સુંદર ભક્ત છે સોની ઝવેર<RHYME_206638>, ઠાર મોરાર વસૈયે ઘર<RHYME_206638>; 
કણબી ભક્ત છે જેસંગભાઈ<RHYME_206639>, રૂગનાથદાસ સુખબાઈ<RHYME_206639>.
gujarati.context: A beautiful devotee is one who has Sona's (gold) jewelry and Thara's (beautiful) home. A true devotee is one who has Jesangbhai's (complete) devotion and Rughnathdasa's (satisfying) happiness.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
બાપુ ધીરો કાશી ને દેસાઈ, વસે ભક્ત નવાગામ માંઇ; 
ભક્ત કણબી કહીએ કાકુજી, મકન મોહન દાજી બાપુજી.
gujarati.context: The devoted son, Bapu, returns from afar, bringing a new soul to his homeland; he asks the lord's permission and is blessed by Mohan Daji, his fatherly deity.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વ્રજભાઈ હરિભાઈ જાણો, દયાળજી મોરારજી પ્રમાણો; 
દ્વિજ પ્રભુરામ વેણીરામ<RHYME_206642>, લુવાર રઘો રહે ગામડી ગામ<RHYME_206642>.
gujarati.context: Know the ways of God and mortal men, as compassion and morality are measured; the two worlds remain entwined like a village and its outskirts.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત છે ભવાનીદાસ<RHYME_206643>, અમથાભાઈનો ચોસરે વાસ<RHYME_206643>; 
હરિજન રૂપો હરિચંદ<RHYME_206644>, રહે હિરાપર ભજે ગોવિંદ<RHYME_206644>.
gujarati.context: The devout Bhavani Das is a humble servant, dwelling in the heart of God; He takes various forms to worship Govind.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજભક્ત કહીએ સદોભાઈ, કાજુ ભક્ત એ કનેજ માંઇ; 
કણબી ભક્ત છે દેવજી નામે, ઠાર જગો નેણપર ગામે.
gujarati.context: A devout devotee is praised forever, and a true believer finds peace in the Lord's name; the one who has faith in God is like a tree that bears fruit in every village.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કોળી ભક્ત કહીએ ઉકો નામ<RHYME_206631>, ભજે હરિ રહે વિરોલ્ય ગામ<RHYME_206631>; 
મોટા ભક્ત છે મેમદાવાદ<RHYME_206646>, ભજ્યા હરિને તજી ઉપાદ<RHYME_206646>.
gujarati.context: A devotee says that they worship Hari (Vishnu) in their village, which is now desolate; a great devotee from Mehmadaavad worships Hari with complete renunciation.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત કહીએ ધનેશ્વર<RHYME_206647>, દુલભરામ ને ભક્ત બેચર<RHYME_206647>; 
ભટ અમથો ને અંબારામ<RHYME_206631>, નિરભેરામ નારણજી નામ<RHYME_206631>.
gujarati.context: A devotee says to Dhaneshwar that Dulabharam is a true devotee, and I am just a foolish one like Ambaram; my name is Narjaniji.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિ પ્રભુજી ને પીતાંબર<RHYME_206648>, વિશ્વનાથ ને શિવશંકર<RHYME_206648>; 
ભક્ત અનુપરામ નાગર<RHYME_206648>, જન મોરારજી ઉજાગર<RHYME_206648>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

God is revered as Pitambar (Lord Vishnu) and Shiv Shankar (Lord Shiva), while the devotee is awakened by the fragrance of devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વ્યાસ મોતી આદિ દઈ ભાઈ<RHYME_206649>, હવે કહું હરિજન બાઈ<RHYME_206649>; 
હરિભક્ત જેઠી રળિયાત<RHYME_206650>, સુખબાને સમજાણી વાત<RHYME_206650>.
gujarati.context:
I'll summarize the Gujarati couplet in English:

"Vyas Mote Adi Dai Bhayi, now I call Harijan Bai; Hari-bhakt Jethi Raliyat, Sukhabane Samajani Vatat."
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
અમૃત અવલ ને શિવબાઈ, ભલાં ભક્ત એ બ્રાહ્મણ માંઇ; 
એહ મેમદાવાદમાં રહે, મુખે સ્વામિનારાયણ કહે.
gujarati.context: The devotee is blessed with the nectar of devotion to Lord Shivbhai, and this Brahmin has attained the highest state of spiritual fulfillment. He resides in Mehsana and bears the mark of his divine name as Swaminarayan on his forehead.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત કહીએ લાલદાસ, ભજે રાયજી શ્રીઅવિનાશ; 
હરિજન એક રામબાઈ<RHYME_206652>, ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત છે સારજીભાઈ<RHYME_206649>.
gujarati.context: The devout devotee Laladas prays to the Lord, while the warrior-bhakt Sarjibhai worships with devotion. These two are alike in their love for God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ બાઈ ભાઈ જેહ<RHYME_206653>, વસે ગામ ખાતરોજે તેહ<RHYME_206653>; 
કણબી ભક્ત પુંજોભાઈ દાજી, રૂડો હરિજન છે રાયજી.
gujarati.context: In this Gujarati couplet, the speaker describes a prosperous village where all are equal and united, with no distinction between high and low castes. Here, devotion and faith are valued over social status.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ દેવરામ બાપુભાઈ<RHYME_206649>, વાંઠવાળી ગુલાબ ગુંસાઈ<RHYME_206655>; 
કોળી ભક્ત છે વસતો નામ<RHYME_206631>, કાજુ ભક્ત વસે કુણે ગામ<RHYME_206631>.
gujarati.context: A devotee like Devaram Bapu is rare as a Gulab flower, and similarly, a devotee who leaves their family and village for God is very uncommon.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત અંબા રળિયાત<RHYME_206650>, ભજે હરિ તજી જગવાત<RHYME_206650>; 
કોળી ભક્ત ગલોભાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206633>, એહ ભક્ત ઘોડાસર લહીએ<RHYME_206633>.
gujarati.context: The devoted devotee of the Lord Aamba will worship Him in this world and the next, while the humble devotee of Krishna will be carried away by the horses of fate.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ખાંટ ભક્ત ભગુજી ભણિયે, ધનો ઘેલો ને જાલ્યમ ગણિયે; 
ઝાલા આદિ જન નિરમળ<RHYME_206657>, એક ભક્ત વસતો રાવળ<RHYME_206657>.
gujarati.context: The devotee, like a hunter, pursues the Lord with zeal, and in devotion, the divine is caught. The pure-minded people, without worldly attachments, are always devoted to their Lord.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

ધન્ય ધન્ય ડભાણનાં જન<RHYME_206632>, જિયાં મહારાજે કર્યા જગન<RHYME_206632>.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ ભાવે ભર્યાં નરનાર્ય, જેના પ્રેમ તણો નહિ પાર; 
પટેલ વિષ્ણુદાસ હરિશરણ<RHYME_206672>, રુગનાથ બે રાયજી ત્રણ<RHYME_206672>.
gujarati.context: A couple's love is so deep that it cannot be measured, and their devotion is beyond the power of anyone to break; just like Patel Vishnudas Hari Sharma, who had three wives from two families.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
પ્રાગદાસ શવદાસ રામ<RHYME_206631>, કાનદાસ નારણદાસ નામ<RHYME_206631>; 
ગોવિંદજી આદિ દઈ ભાઈઓ, અવલ બોના ત્રણ દત્ત બાઇયો.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotee's name is Ram, and his brothers are Govindji and others; they received three gifts from the Lord.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત કહીએ મયારામ<RHYME_206631>, કુબેરજી પ્રભુરામ નામ<RHYME_206631>; 
નિરભેરામ ગોવિંદ પ્રેમદત્ત<RHYME_206673>, હરિકૃષ્ણ કશલજી ભક્ત<RHYME_206673>.
gujarati.context: The devout devotee says My Lord is Kubera, the God of wealth; Gopinath, the embodiment of love and devotion, and Krishna, the beloved Lord of all devotees.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
બાઈ શિવ આદિત અમૂલ<RHYME_206674>, નવલ ગુલાલ સાકર ફૂલ<RHYME_206674>; 
એહાદિ દ્વિજ બાઇયો પાવન<RHYME_206632>, કોળી વખતો છે હરિજન<RHYME_206632>.
gujarati.context:
A brother's love is like an unending stream and a new rose; it's a sacred bond that lasts until death.

This couplet praises the eternal nature of a sibling's affection, comparing it to a constant flow and a rare flower.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
શૂદ્ર ભક્ત કાળો એક કહીએ<RHYME_206633>, એહાદિ જન ડભાણ લહીએ<RHYME_206633>; 
પટેલ ભક્ત ભગવાનદાસ<RHYME_206675>, જાદવ ઝવેરી જગથી ઉદાસ<RHYME_206675>.
gujarati.context: A low-caste devotee's love is pure and untainted, while a high-born devotee like Patel Bhakt or Jadeja Javeri may be great in the world but lacks inner devotion.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કાનદાસ ને દ્વિજ મોરાર<RHYME_206637>, એહાદિ જન પીજ મોઝાર<RHYME_206637>; 
કોળી ભક્ત એક જાગો નામ<RHYME_206631>, ભજે હરિ રહે ટુંડેલ્ય ગામ<RHYME_206631>.
gujarati.context: In the midst of worldly desires, one should not forget to worship God, just like a humble devotee from a small village. The devotee's love for God is pure and unconditional, just like the beauty of a small village.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત રુગનાથ જોડ<RHYME_206676>, કાનજી રવજી રણછોડ<RHYME_206676>; 
ભક્ત નરોત્તમ વેરિદાસ<RHYME_206643>, એહ જન ડુમરાલે વાસ<RHYME_206643>.
gujarati.context: The Patel devotee is united with the Lord, while Kanji and Ravji are mere mortal men; the greatest devotee, Vairdaas, has no worldly attachments.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ રાયજી કુબેર કહીએ<RHYME_206633>, રણછોડ બાપુજી બે લહીએ<RHYME_206633>; 
વસનદાસ કૃષ્ણદાસ જાણો, વસતો દલોભાઈ પ્રમાણો.
gujarati.context: Patel Raya and Kubera's words are as fleeting as a dream, while Vasnodas and Krishnadas' promises are as solid as a mountain.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી લાલ એક હરિજન<RHYME_206632>, વસે પિપલગે તે પાવન<RHYME_206632>; 
દ્વિજ મોહનરામ નરોત્તમ<RHYME_206677>, દ્વિજ ગંગારામ છે ઉત્તમ<RHYME_206677>.
gujarati.context: A warrior is equal to a virtuous person, and one who dwells in Pipalage is considered blessed. The divine Mohanram and Gangaram are the best among the twice-born.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ કંકુ આદિત અચરત<RHYME_206678>, માનકુંવર્ય છે હરિભક્ત<RHYME_206673>; 
કડિયા ભક્ત છે કેવળરામ<RHYME_206631>, એહાદિ જન નડિયાદ ગામ<RHYME_206631>.
gujarati.context: The devotee of God is like a twin jewel, shining bright with spiritual devotion; their love for God is pure and unwavering. Their faith is strong, like the people living in Nadiad village, which is far from worldly attachments.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી ભક્ત એક કાળિદાસ<RHYME_206670>, રહે ગામ અલિંદરે વાસ<RHYME_206670>;

gujarati.context: A devoted worshiper is like a Kalidasa of the times, residing in a village where God's name is revered; the devout one worships Hari, remaining absorbed in His name in the village.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ જન અગણિત<RHYME_206679>, સર્વે જનને સ્વામીશું પ્રીત<RHYME_206679>; 
ધર્મ નિયમ ધારી નરનાર્ય, ન લખાય છે અપરમપાર.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that the divine is within every individual, and it's our duty to love all beings equally; only then can we truly follow the principles of righteousness and morality.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
જુગો જુગના જનથી, અગણિત ઓધાર્યા આજ<RHYME_206680>;

gujarati.context: As people are separated from their true nature, they're stuck in ignorance today; even the poet can't express it, as if no one has any clue.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૧: ગુજર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 121: Gujar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A true person is revealed through their actions, not just words. One's character is known by the good deeds they do, and not just by their name.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The fortunate soul is one who has devoted their life to God's work, and in that devotion finds true liberation. Such a devotee transcends worldly suffering and reaches the ultimate state of spiritual freedom.

transliteration.couplet:

Bhakta Kākujī Bhikhārīdās, Pītāmbar bhaje Avināsh.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotee Gangādās worships Prabhudās with devotion, seeking spiritual guidance; Bhakta Kākujī Bhikhārīdās longs to worship Pītāmbar Avināsh.

transliteration.couplet:
Joyatādās Jīvaṇ kahīe, Kṛuṣhṇadās Kāshīdās lahīe; <RHYME_5>
Bhakta khoḍo Nathu Punjobhāī, ehādi Paṭel kahevāi.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: A devotee's joy is unmatched, like a sweet treat from Lord Krishna; their troubles are washed away by the Lord's mercy, just like the Ganges River cleansing the city of Kashi.

transliteration.couplet:

Ūgarchand ne Becharbhāī, bāī raḷiyāt Harkhabāī.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: A devotee's hope is in heaven and the mercy of God. A person's fate is decided by their own actions, not chance or others.

transliteration.couplet:

Māḷī Māṇyak Shā ne Kuber, bhakta ghelo kharo nahi fer.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A virtuous and humble person is dear to God, and their life is pure and noble. Even if they are poor, they do not beg as their devotion to God is strong.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi chhe jan apār, vase Jetalpur mozār; <RHYME_8>
Paṭel bhakta Veṇībhāī kahīe, Lāldās Kāḷidās lahīe.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: This couplet describes the vibrant and lively city of Jetpur, where people from all over come to enjoy its festivities, just like devotees flock to Patel Bhakta Veenee and Laldas Kaldas for spiritual fulfillment.

transliteration.couplet:
Gopāl Hānsajī harijan, Harakhā ādi chhe bhakta pāvan; <RHYME_9>
Dvij Bhago ne Khushālbhāī, ehādi jan Ashalālī māi.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Gopāl is considered a lower-caste person (Harijan), yet he has achieved spiritual salvation; similarly, Dvij Bhago has also attained divine love despite being from an ordinary family.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization:

The couplet compares the virtues of two individuals, Bhagujī Mālajī and Nathujī Devojī, highlighting their moral excellence.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

There are two kinds of devotees: one who has a beautiful soul like Zaver and the other who has an enlightened mind like Jesangbhāī.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet describes a devotee's pure love for God, likening it to the affection of a mother towards her child. This love is so strong that even death cannot separate them from their beloved deity.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

May God, filled with mercy, be our guide; May we always stay in harmony like the rivers flowing to their destinations.

transliteration.context: Bhavānīdās is a devotee who has a deep connection with the divine, and his words have power to bring solace to others. He worships Govind while residing in Hirāpar, having renounced worldly attachments.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

Moṭā bhakta chhe Memadāvād, bhajyā Harine tajī upād.  <RHYME_16>

transliteration.couplet:

Bhaṭ Amatho ne Ambārām, Nirabherām Nāraṇajī nām.  <RHYME_17>

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Ambā raḷiyāt, bhaje Hari tajī jag-vāt; <RHYME_24>

transliteration.couplet:
Khānṭ bhakta Bhagujī bhaṇiye, Dhano Ghelo ne Jālyam gaṇiye; <RHYME_25>
Zālā ādi jan niramaḷ, ek bhakta vasato Rāvaḷ.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: A devotee Bhagujī is remembered for his love, while Dhano Ghelo's words bring joy to the masses; In olden days, people were pure of heart, and a single devotee like Rāvaḷ would suffice.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan ek Adibāī, vase gām Hātharoli māi; <RHYME_26>
Kaṇabī bhakta Kāshīdās kahīe, bhakta Bhāījī vase Pīṭhaie.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: A devotee named Kāshīdās narrates a story of a poor woman from Hātharoli village who was a true devotee, and another devotee named Bhāījī recounts the tale of a rich merchant's daughter.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij Nāraṇajī Sadobhāī, bāī Dhanabāī Rājabāī; <RHYME_27>
Eh ādi bījā bāī bhāī, vase gām Kaṭhalāl māi.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The couplet is about two brothers, Dvij Naranaji and Sadobhai, who are also friends with a girl named Dhana Bai Rabari. The phrase "Eh adi bija bai bai" means that they have come together like seeds sown in the fertile land of Katrala Maan (home).

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta chhe Nirabherām, Kuberbhāī Shankar nām; <RHYME_28>
Harijan ek Kankubāī, kaṇabī bhakta Shambhu Jīvobhāī.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The devotee is a noble soul, named Shankar, with devotion to Lord Nirabhera; Another devotee, Harijan, has the name Kankuba and worships Lord Shambhoo.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi jan rahe Āntaroḷī, kare bhakti Prabhujīnī bahoḷī; <RHYME_29>
Kaṇabī bhakta Bhagwāndās, Prabhudās bhaje Avināsh.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The inner self (jan) remains pure and devoted to God (Prabhu), while the external self (Antaroḷī) engages in devotion with fervor. A devotee (Bhakta) loves God (Bhagwān) without end, and God loves that devotee equally.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta ek Dayāḷjī nāme, jan vase Chikhalor gāme; <RHYME_30>
Dvij bhakta Shivajī sundar, harijan Gopāl Bechar.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: A devotee named Dayāḷjī lives in a village where people are simple and pure of heart; another devotee, Shivajī, is beautiful and kind-hearted like Lord Hari's servant Gopāl.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek dvij chhe Amṛutbāī, eh jan Kapaḍavan māi; <RHYME_31>
Dvij amulakh harijan, vase Devodya gāme pāvan.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a devotee, Amṛutbāī, who is considered holy and pure like the God Kapaḍavan; she is also referred to as "dvij", signifying her spiritual stature.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta kahīe Kāshīdās, lakhiye Luṇāvāḍāmā vās; <RHYME_32>
Dvij bhakta chhe Khushāl nām, jan Haribhāī Abherām.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: A devotee named Kāshīdās is from the town of Luṇāvāḍā, while a devotee named Khushāl is considered twice-born and has Haribhāī as his guru.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi kahīe bahu jan, vase Vāḍāsindore pāvan; <RHYME_33>
Haribhakta aval vaṇik, bāī Rāyakuvarya chhe ek.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: Many people know about the great Vāḍāsindore, but few have achieved greatness like Haribhakta, who has excellent business acumen.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi harijan sundar, bhaje Hari rahe Vīrapar; <RHYME_34>
Dvij bhakta chhe Vālajībhāī, koḷī harijan Mondhībāī.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: A beautiful woman from the Harijan community is devoted to Lord Krishna, while a twice-born devotee, Valaji, has a wife named Mondhi from the same community.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi jan bāī bhāī, vase satasangī Suth māi; <RHYME_35>
Kaṇabī bhakta Kuberjī kahīe, Kaḍavo gām Goṭhavamā lahīe.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: A devotee's love is not limited by physical proximity; even from a distant place, one can recall the Lord's name and attain liberation.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta sutār Govind jāṇo, vaishya jāti Vālajī pramāṇo; <RHYME_36>
Eh ādi bāī bhāī bahu, vase gām Rāmapare sahu.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: The devotee's wealth is knowing God Govind, while a Vaishya's prosperity lies in measuring Vālajī; this humble hut is filled with Lord Rama's sweet presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Pītāmbar kahīe, kaṇabī Khushāl Tulasī lahīe; <RHYME_37>
Kuber ne Himo Bhāvasār, rahe Hirāpar gām mozār.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: A devotee of Lord Shiva, Pītāmbar, is said to have taken a Tulasī leaf from Khushāl's hand, and a merchant named Kuber has been stuck in the city of Hirāpar for many days.

transliteration.couplet:
Satasangī ek satavāro, haribhakta Kāshīrām sāro; <RHYME_38>
Dvij harijan Rūpabāī, rahe jan e Godharā māi.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: A true devotee is one who has a pure heart and mind, just like the Ganges River that flows freely in Kashi. A person of high birth or social standing can be considered lowly if they lack spiritual wisdom and self-control.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Umreṭhe ati sārā, premījan Prabhujīne pyārā; <RHYME_39>
Dvij Rūparām Nirabherām, Nandu Nandalāl doya nām.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Devotion to God Umreṭhe is excellent, and love for Lord Krishna is dear; Dwij Rūparām Nirabherām prays with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Mādhavajī ne Malakā Arjun, Kāshīrām Kṛupāshankar jan; <RHYME_40>
Lakṣhmīdatta vaḷī Līlādhar, bhakta Haribhāī ne Īshvar.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: Madhavaji and Malaka Arjun are considered fortunate by Kashiram, a kind-hearted person. Lakshmidadta and Liladhar are playful in their devotion to God, who is all-encompassing and divine.

transliteration.couplet:
Gangādatta Viṣhṇudatta bhāī, Dayārām kahu have bāī; <RHYME_41>

transliteration.context: A brother is like a God to us, as we share our belongings with each other. A kind-hearted person shares their wealth and wisdom with others, while a good person shares their family's honor and reputation.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi jan bāī bhāī, vase gām Umareṭh māi; <RHYME_42>
Kaṇabī Galobhāī Gopāḷ nāme, bhaje Hari rahe Oḍ gāme.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: This couplet is about a brother and sister who have taken vows of devotion to Lord Krishna at Umareth village, and they dance with joy in the name of Gopala.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Kuberjī bhalo, bhaje Hari Ḍākore ekalo; <RHYME_43>
Harijan dvij Devabāī, vase gām Palāsaṇā māi.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: A devotee like Kuberji is good, he sings the glory of Hari alone; He is a true servant of God, living in the forest of devotion.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee named Rugnathdas is deeply devoted to the divine; similarly, a warrior named Galuji melts into devotion at the mention of Lord Krishna's name.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A Gujarati couplet summarizing two individuals: Kaṇabī Bhūdhardās Rāyajī, a hopeful devotee of Prabhudās, and Dvij Nāraṇ Āṇandrām, a woman named Ambā from the Harijan community.

transliteration.couplet:

Dvij bhakta Ruganāth nām, Maheshvar ne Manchhārām.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two devotees: Kṣhatrī Jījībā, who worships Sukhbāī, and Ruganāth, a dvij (twice-born) devotee of Maheshvar.

transliteration.couplet:
Maiyārām kahīe Kāḷidās, Rāyajī ne Giradhar Vyās; <RHYME_47>

transliteration.context: The couplet praises Kāḷidās and Rāyajī for their literary works, with Ambā Aval being a metaphor for the beauty of Gujarat's language.

transliteration.couplet:

Dvij Harakhjī Jeṭho jan, vase gām Kesare pāvan.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context:
The righteous king's duty is to worship God and protect the people; the brave warrior's duty is to defend the country with honor.

The powerful Brahmin's duty is to teach the truth and guide the nation.

transliteration.couplet:

Kṣhatrī bhakta Ajubhāī kahīe, Kāḷābhāī ādi jan lahīe.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: A devotee's speech is like a tender leaf, fragile and easily broken; A king's devotee speaks with authority, his words commanding respect.

transliteration.couplet:

Kaṇabī bhakta Bhagwānbhāī, Bhūdhardās Hātharolī māi.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: A devotee named Rāyajī resides in God's village from the very beginning. Another devotee, Bhagwānbhāī, is under the care of Bhūdhardās and his mother Hātharolī.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan dvij kahīe Kalo, vase bhakta Degāme ekalo; <RHYME_51>
Dhanya dhanya Ḍabhāṇnā jan, jiyā Mahārāje karyā jagan.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises the selfless devotee who is a true servant of God, unlike others who are consumed by their own interests. The devotee's heart is full of gratitude and joy in serving the Lord.

transliteration.couplet:

Paṭel Viṣhṇudās Hari-sharaṇ, Rugnāth be Rāyajī traṇ.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: A husband's excessive love can overwhelm his wife, and it's impossible to go beyond the bounds of love; Patel Vishnu Das is a refuge for me, like Rayaji's mercy.

transliteration.couplet:

Govindajī ādi daī bhāīo, aval Bonā traṇ datta bāiyo.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the names of two brothers, Pragadas and Shavadases Rama, and their elder brother Govindaji, who was given a boon by Lord Brahma.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotees are divided into three categories: Mayārām (devotees of God), Kuberjī Prabhurām (those who have attained spiritual wealth), and Nirabherām Govind (those who have transcended worldly attachments).

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The phrase describes a couple who are pure and innocent like the flower "amul", with their love sweet like rose petal and hibiscus. It also highlights that this couple is considered pure and holy, just like the sacred cow, as per Hindu traditions.

transliteration.couplet:

Paṭel bhakta Bhagwāndās, Jādav Zaverī jagthī udās.  <RHYME_56>
transliteration.context: A devotee from the Shudra caste is considered lowly, but one who has devotion is elevated; a Patel devotee like Bhagwandas and a business magnate like Jadav Zaveri are equally revered.

transliteration.couplet:

Koḷī bhakta ek Jāgo nām, bhaje Hari rahe Ṭunḍelya gām.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the devotion of a devotee who has realized God (Morār) and has left worldly attachments; their soul is now absorbed in the Lord's name, like a cowherd tending to cows in the land of Vrndavana.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Rugnāth joḍ, Kānajī Ravajī Raṇachhoḍ; <RHYME_58>
Bhakta Narottam Veridās, eh jan Ḍumarāle vās.  <RHYME_58>
transliteration.context: A devotee (Paṭel) Rugnāth is born in a wealthy family, but then gives up wealth for devotion. Similarly, Bhakta Narottam Veridās renounced worldly life to take shelter at the Lotus Feet of the Lord.

transliteration.couplet:

Vasanadās Kṛuṣhṇadās jāṇo, vasato Dalobhāī pramāṇo.  <RHYME_59>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

"Paṭel Rāyajī Kuber and Raṇachhoḍ Bāpujī are known for their good deeds, while Vasanadās and Kṛuṣhṇadās are judged by their character."

transliteration.couplet:

Dvij Mohanrām Narottam, dvij Gangārām chhe uttam.  <RHYME_60>
transliteration.context: A king from the Harijan community is considered pure because he lives under a sacred fig tree. Among Brahmins, Dwij Mohan and Gangaram are considered the best.

transliteration.couplet:

Kaḍiyā bhakta chhe Kevaḷrām, ehādi jan Naḍiyād gām.  <RHYME_61>
transliteration.context: A true devotee is one who has the divine in their heart, and not just someone who goes to the temple. A real believer is one who finds God's presence in every moment, not just in a specific place.

transliteration.couplet:

Dvij bhakta Prabhurām nāme, bhaje Hari rahe Saluṇ gāme.  <RHYME_62>
transliteration.context: A devotee named Kāḷidās lives in the village of Alindare, while another devotee named Prabhurām worships Hari in the village of Saluṇ. Both live in their respective villages and serve the Lord.

transliteration.couplet:

Dharma niyam dhārī nar-nārya, na lakhāy chhe aparampār.  <RHYME_63>
transliteration.context: God's ways are infinite and unknown, yet loved by all. Humans and women alike follow dharma and tradition, without questioning the unconventional.

transliteration.couplet:
Jugo jugnā janthī, agaṇit odhāryā āj; <RHYME_64>
Tene te gaṇit lakhatā, nāve koī kavine thāh ja.  <RHYME_64>
transliteration.context: The days pass by like dust, and the accounts of our past are countless; Let's not forget to count the joys we've had, before it's too late.
